main event: A bright light was observed on the western horizon, disappearing in a flash after establishing radar contact at an altitude of 30-40,000 ft and speed of 600-700 mph.
interesting points: The radar indicated contact for about 1 minute before the light disappeared., The observer had a prior ground-radar contact in July 1952 at Vandalia, Ohio., The light was described as being of 'very high intensity' by the observer., An F-86 was scrambled to investigate but did not make contact., Investigations indicated that there were no known balloons, aircraft, or meteors in the area at the time.
witness description: Observer with prior radar contact experience
